duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead cost accounting and financial oversight for Plant Operations.
Take the lead in the annual budget process for the plant, shaping realistic financial projections.
Supervise and mentor both indirect and direct reports, fostering a culture of collaboration, growth, and high performance within the finance team.
Prepare and dissect monthly Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and other critical financial metrics for the plant.
Manage crucial month-end closing tasks, including inventory and other operation-related accounts. Present monthly financial statements and operational reports.
Oversee the maintenance of the operation’s bill of materials and routing processes. Analyze production variances, driving continuous improvement.
Regularly provide analytical information and schedules to plant management and other functional department heads. Serve as a valued financial partner in driving informed decision-making.
Develop cost/projection analyses for new and existing business opportunities, contributing to effective pricing strategies and maintaining profitability.
Manage Fixed Assets and Capital Expense Request processes, ensuring prudent financial management and alignment with corporate goals.
Maintain adherence to federal, state, and local regulations, safeguarding the integrity of financial operations.
Empower business unit leaders with comprehensive financial insights. Assist in interpreting financial performance, cost drivers, and forecasts to guide strategic initiatives.
Champion special projects that bolster Operational Excellence, controlling expenses, boosting profits, optimizing cash flow, and enhancing plant efficiencies.
Lead annual physical inventory counts and supervise the plant’s cycle counting program, fostering accuracy in financial reporting.
Tackle additional duties as assigned with a proactive and adaptable approach.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance, coupled with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite, particularly Excel (pivot tables, lookups, conditional formatting, etc.), Power BI, Teams, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word.
Adept at account analysis and reconciliation preparation, including the utilization of online tools such as Blackline.
